title: Wolves' Kortney Hause is stretchered off
text:
Hause pulled up with a hamstring injury in the second half. 
And early indications are that the injury is 'fairly serious', according to the club. 
The 20-year-old, who looked in some distress as he was stretched down the tunnel, will be assessed over the next couple of days. 
But he looks set to face a spell on the sidelines - leaving Wolves desperately short of defensive cover. 
Conor Coady filled in for Hause at the back with only teenage left back Sylvain Deslandes a defensive option on the bench. 
Ethan Ebanks-Landell is out with a broken foot and won't return to training for at least another week. 
Dominic Iorfa missed the Middlesbrough defeat through suspension, although a knee injury would have kept him out anyway. 
However Iorfa is expected to return for the short trip to Birmingham next weekend. 
Kenny Jackett said of Hause's injury: "It was a classic hamstring injury, he's turned to run in that channel and he's struggled and had to come off on a stretcher.
